brand.name: Agency Brewing
brand.tagline: Where Advertising Creativity Meets Brewing Craft
target_audience: Creative professionals who understand agency culture
Those drawn to brands that feel considered, not commercial
People who appreciate quality without needing it explained
brand.positioning: Each beer is treated as a new brief. Distinct in expression, consistent in standards.
brand.core_philosophy: Great work and great beer both benefit from balance, restraint, and intention.

voice_pillars.name: Effortless Intelligence
voice_pillars.description: Short, sharp thoughts. Minimal punctuation. No exclamation points unless earned. Confident but never loud. Clever without winking too hard.
examples: Made for the moment you log off.

voice_pillars.name: Creative Culture, Translated
voice_pillars.description: Advertising references used sparingly, only if they land for non-industry folks too. Inside jokes that still feel inclusive. Culture > credentials.
examples: This meeting could've been a beer.

voice_pillars.name: Lightness in All Forms
voice_pillars.description: Sessionable beer. Sessionable copy. Short sentences. Breathing room. Nothing overwrought.
examples: Balance is part of the craft.

voice_pillars.name: Social Club Energy
voice_pillars.description: Feels like being 'in,' without needing a membership card. Welcoming. Conversational. Community-forward.

copy_guidelines.fundamental_principle: Copy is not there to sell first—it's there to set tone, create familiarity, and signal taste. Social copy should feel like overhearing a smart, relaxed comment at the end of a table, not a brand announcement.

rules: Let the image carry the weight
sentence_structure.bad_example: Our Session IPA is designed for creatives who value balance and quality craftsmanship. This is the perfect beer to enjoy after a long day of work with friends or coworkers.
sentence_structure.good_example: Made for the moment you log off. Work's done.

punctuation.lowercase: Acceptable when it fits the mood

copy_guidelines.hashtags: Minimal, purposeful, often none at all

humor.rule: If it needs explaining, it doesn't ship

short_form.description: Default mode. 1-3 words to one short sentence. Minimal punctuation. Let the image carry the weight.

longer_form.description: When needed. 2-3 proper sentences. Same voice principles apply. Best for milestones, cultural moments, or when context adds value.
examples: LA Beer Fest turns 20 this weekend. Two decades of showing up. That's a milestone.

instagram.voice: Confident, minimal, aware of design and pacing
guidelines: Let the image do the heavy lifting
Occasional commentary on work, culture, or time
examples: This meeting could've been a beer.
Out with friends. In good company. That's the idea.

tiktok.voice: Casual but considered, self-aware, slightly looser but still intentional
guidelines: Feels like a passing thought, not a setup
Let the video do the talking
examples: this is the part of the day we like.
The best advertising campaigns start with a focused brief. We applied that same discipline to our first beer. For creative professionals who understand that process drives results.

in_person.tone: Warm, confident, let the beer speak
in_person.elevator_pitch: Agency Brewing—where advertising creativity meets brewing craft. Try the Session IPA.
in_person.advertising_connection_response: We're creatives who got obsessed with brewing. Same discipline—concept, iteration, execution.

content_frameworks.name: Product as Campaign
content_frameworks.tone: Confident presentation, like launching a campaign
examples: Session IPA. Six months of obsessive iteration, one breakthrough concept. Available now at [location]. This is what happens when creative directors brew beer.
Batch #3 sealed. Like any great campaign, refinement is endless. Same concept, even better execution. Cans dropping this week.

content_frameworks.name: Process as Creative Development
examples: Cold conditioning for two weeks because great concepts need time to develop. Like creative work, rushing the execution kills the idea. Patience equals quality.
Taste-testing batch #4 today. In advertising, you kill your darlings to find breakthrough concepts. Brewing's no different. Iteration is everything.

content_frameworks.name: Community as Collaboration
content_frameworks.tone: Collaborative but confident, building creative community
examples: To everyone who grabbed cans this week—your feedback is gold. Great creative work requires dialogue. What are you tasting? Drop notes below.
Festival season starts soon. Come taste what happens when advertising creativity meets brewing craft. Great beer, like great ideas, starts conversations.

content_frameworks.name: Milestones as Campaign Results
content_frameworks.tone: Confident acknowledgment, not celebration for its own sake
examples: Batch #1 sold out. When execution meets concept, people respond. Batch #2 drops next week. This is what campaign-worthy results look like.
First festival pour complete. Watching people discover our Session IPA for the first time—that creative validation drives everything. More events coming.

content_frameworks.name: Differentiation Through Creative DNA
content_frameworks.use_when: Explaining what makes Agency Brewing different
examples: Most breweries focus on tradition. We focus on concept and execution—the same rigor that drives breakthrough advertising. Different DNA, exceptional beer.
Advertising taught us that process drives results. Every batch gets the same attention a creative director gives their best work. Taste the difference.

product_focused: A beer that knows when to step back.
brand_philosophy: Balance is part of the craft.
light_humor: Another meeting that could've been avoided.

out_of_office.description: Dry observations about logging off, leaving early, inbox avoidance, and deserved breaks. Celebrating moments away from work, not complaining about it.

agency_insider.description: Knowing nod to shared agency experiences—late nights, revision rounds, client calls, deadline pushes. Dry acknowledgment, not venting.
agency_insider.best_paired_with: Festival escapes, long weekends, earned moments
examples: Twenty years of early setups and late nights.

buzzword_bingo.description: Fair game for humor—but only when actually using them in context. The jest comes from deploying the buzzword while acknowledging its absurdity. Don't just list or mock in isolation.
buzzword_bingo.example_usage: Let's circle back after this beer. Or maybe just stay here.

client_feedback_classics.description: Universal creative frustrations that bond the community (gallows humor)
terms: I'll know it when I see it

content_pillars.name: Product, Quietly
content_pillars.description: Can details. Pour shots. Natural light. No hard sell.

content_pillars.name: Out Of Office Philosophy
content_pillars.description: Leaving work. Reclaiming time. Small freedoms. Everyday rituals.

content_pillars.name: Creative Culture
content_pillars.description: Process. Inspiration. Analog moments. Studio life.

content_pillars.name: Community & Social Club
content_pillars.description: Events. Gatherings. Shared tables. Familiar faces.

content_pillars.name: Design & Timelessness
content_pillars.description: Aesthetic appreciation. Intentional choices. Visual craft.

engagement.core_principle: Agency Brewing doesn't dominate conversations—it joins them.

principles.acknowledge_over_amplify: Respond to comments without redirecting everything back to sales
principles.reward_creatives: Repost thoughtful tags. Highlight photographers, designers, bartenders. Credit always.
principles.irl_to_url_loop: Encourage bar sightings, casual moments, design-forward UGC

emergency_response.quality_issue: Every can matters. DM us and we'll make this right.

voice_authenticity: Sounds like Agency Brewing, not generic craft beer
Advertising connection is natural, not forced
execution_quality: Free of clichés or tired craft beer tropes

approved: Natural voice, zero 'trying too hard' moments
needs_revision: Agency speak feels forced or cliché
rejected: Negative or comparative in wrong way

nightlife: Hard strobe or high-contrast shadows acceptable
Less branded, more living in the moment

subjects.spaces: Always feel authentic and real, never artificial
subjects.experience: Capture enjoyment—mix of close-ups and longer shots for intimate and collective moments
subjects.products: Detail shots—pops of color, interesting compositions, authentic feel
subjects.events: Capture freedom and energy through sensorial, exciting imagery
subjects.locations: Candid, in-action shots of community activities—never staged

final_principles.principle: The beer speaks louder than the words.

final_principles.explanation: Not from trying to seem bigger than we are.
Connections with people who share our values.

writing_checklist: Is this short enough? Default to fewer words.
Does this sound like us? Not generic craft beer.
Is the advertising connection natural? Never forced.
Would a creative professional nod at this? Insider recognition.
Is there confidence without arrogance? Quiet assurance.
Does this need the image to work? Let visuals carry weight.

metadata.purpose: Training AI content generation systems and human content creators
